data.title: Excellent food served by excellent people
data.text: We have been to Cotto at least 7 time and have been disappointed. It has a great bar which we love to eat at.

data.title: One of Stamford's Hidden Treasures
data.text:
Small cozy establishment with a wealth of entrees ranging from the traditional fare to modern twists on these same items
The pasta is always fresh and the portions are perfect for a light snack or a hearty meal

data.title: Food good, service so so.
data.text: Had dinner hear a week ago Saturday for a party of 6.  The food was very good, except for the bread which tasted stale and compared to the rest of the food was quite a let down.  The service was so so, and the 20% gratuity they added to the bill seemed a bit underhanded.  We received the bill and then returned it with our CC, at that time there was no tip added and no mention of it.  If the policy is to add it for parties of 6 or more, we did not see it anywhere.  When we got the bill back and noticed the addition of the tip we mentioned it and the waiter said that it was standard and walked away.  Typically we give at least 20%, so the amount was not the issue but rather the manner in which is was presented.  Ended the evening with a bad feeling about this restaurant.

data.title: Loud, mediocre and expensive
data.text: The place is shaped like a barrel with wooden slats and a glass store front.  It is so loud you can hardly hear yourself think.  The food was average but expensive.  No pizza was available so effectively 1/3 of the menu was 86'd.   Wine was good but expensive.  Service was fine but that was probably because there were only 2 parties actually dining.  Everyone else was standing around tall tables yelling at each other.

data.title: Horrible atmosphere
data.text: Our party of four had a really unpleasant dining experience at Cotto tonight.  When we arrived at 7:45, the restaurant was almost empty – only 2 people at the bar and 2 tables with customers – so we didn’t really care where we sat.  We were seated at a table towards the rear of the restaurant, with no one around us.  We did not notice a large empty table further back towards the rear and in the corner.  After we ordered and began our meal, that table began to fill up until it was filled by a party of ten.  They were extremely loud, at times shouting from one end of the table to have a “conversation”.  By that time, it made no sense to change tables so we had to endure that group and shout among ourselves to be heard.  If the maitre d’ had told us that table would be filled, we could have had a table at the front of the restaurant and enjoyed our meal.  When I pointed this out to the maitre d’, he said that group had a reservation – but that was not my point.  Our bad experience could have been avoided if the restaurant had warned us of the group that would be coming and had seated us in a more appropriate location.

data.title: Good but noisy
data.text:
The food is great. You will not be disappointed with the many dishes served in this restaurant.
Friendly welcome. Good location. 

However I have to tell you this place is most of the time both crowded and noisy.

Give it a try.

data.title: Varied tapas and other Italian food
data.text: The staff was polite and attentive. There was a good variety of food on the menu. However, I mainly focused on the tapas, I had the roasted beet & goat cheese terrine, potato croquettes, roasted marcona almonds with whipped ricotta & honey, fried zucchini with served with marinara & horseradish hollandaise, and Brussels sprouts with smoked pancetta & caramelized onions. I also had a side of truffle fries. It was fun tasting all of the tapas in search my favorite one. In the end I really liked the Brussels sprouts which were perfectly cooked and had a delicious flavor.

data.title: Lovely discovery in downtown Stamford
data.text: Exploring restaurants in downtown Stamford we stumbled across this gem. Great Italian food, fine wines and stellar service. And the best thing it is only steps away from our apartment.

data.title: Tasty, Casual and Chic Italian Dining
data.text:
This was a first visit to Cotto's. I was meeting a friend from New York for a catch up dinner. My friend wanted a good selection of wine and I wanted fresh, light and tasty Italian. Cotto's didn't disappoint.

The food was excellent and our service was good. This only ding I would give is that l had to ask for silverware after our food arrived. If not for that and being a bit slow on our drink refills this would be a five-star rating. 

Loved the urban, chic detail and the pictures of Italian Americans on the wall. I thought it was a nice personal touch and welcoming. I liked that they also had a few tables for outdoor dinner. The night was perfect for dinning outside so we sat outside. No need to get dolled up, Cotto's is a restaurant where you can be casual and comfortable.

If you love extra virgin olive oil, make sure to dip your complimentary fresh bread in it. Scrumptous! I recommend their caprese salad and calamari for starters. My husband enjoyed the surf and turf special. I had a homemade pasta dish in a light white wine and EVOO sauce with black pepper and pecorino cheese. My friend enjoyed his arugula salad with grilled salmon. Everything was prepared well.

Looking for tasty Italian and casual dinning, check out Cotto's.

data.title: Home Made
data.text: Cotto's home made starters and entrées  are worth the visit. I judge a restaraunt on whether I could prepare it better or not. Cotto does well enpughto recommend it Small restaurant ideal for couples.

data.title: Fun restaurant, acceptable food
data.text:
Nice decor, very good service and acceptable food.
Common to most restaurant, when Cotto is crowded (such as, Saturday night), conversation it's almost impossible.

data.title: Cotto
data.text: Food is excellent, beautiful presentation.   Manilla is the sweetest server and always provides the proper choice of wine for your taste.

data.title: Good food and friendly staff
data.text: Cotto offers good food and a welcoming atmosphere to everyone. The decor is clean and modern. Food is Italian, with an extensive wine list. You will be satisfied with your dinner and even happier when the reasonable bill arrives. Wine is half price on Sunday.

data.title: Freshly made dishes, extensive wine list and accommodating service staff!
data.text: Our first visit here and a 21st birthday celebration for a daughter. I had the prosciutto for an appetizer and it was of excellent quality. For an entree, shrimp fra diavolo with spaghetti - which tasted very freshly made and was not overwhelming spicy. One oddity, I booked on Open Table for 4 pm on a Saturday and found that they didn't officially open until 5 pm that day - but the manager seated us nonetheless and placed our orders without the need to wait an hour. The wine list is extensive, with some very expensive barolos, but more moderate bottles can be found. They gladly took a cake we brought in with us and happily served it at the close. All in all, a worthwhile Italian with a very friendly staff and worth a return visit.

data.title: Wonderful Authentic Italian in all aspects.
data.text: We had reservations at 6 pm on a Sat evening ansd arrived early and were promptly seated. The inside looked and felt like a small Italian village restairant....homey and welcoming atmosphere. We were served by Jessica who was absolutely trerrific all evening. Sense of humor and she knew the details for the menu items. We were never rushed and service was impeccable. We started with a bottle of Rosso de Montalcino and a plate of charcuterie which was delicious, fresh and nicely presented. My wife followed with a green salad and I had the Mussell's Impepata which were delicious. My wife followed with Pappardella alla Bolognese which was homemade and delicious. I had the Spaghetti Carbonara which was also excellent. A cup of cafe latte finished off a perfect evening. We will definately be back next time we are in the area. I might add we were in Tuscany last year for 3 weeks and this restaurant would have fit in nicely there.

data.title: Great food and wine
data.text: Went with 10 coworkers for dinner. Ordered lots of appetizers to the table with wine. They were so good we skipped the main course and went straight to desert!

data.title: Fresh! Perfect.
data.text: Always fresh and tasty. Great flavor pairings. Awesome decor with exposed brick and black and white vintage photos. Really good quality. Fresh mozz is to die for.

data.title: Unexpected Surprise!
data.text: Went to Cotto recently and really enjoyed our meal.  The food arrived in a timely manner, was hot, and was really delicious.  Best of all the prices were not crazy sky high like so many of the upscale eateries in Stamford.  The fried calamari was tender and tasty, and the beet salad was strong as well. We all had pasta for our main dishes which were all terrific.  The homemade Tornnarelli Cacio and Pepe was the best pasta dish we tried.  The restaurant has a good wine list and this coupled with strong service made for a great meal.  On a Saturday night the place was packed and had a great vibe.  Unlike so many of the overpriced restaurants by the Stamford Mall I will be returning to this gem.

data.title: Live in the Stamford
data.text: This is the number one restaurant that we go to. The owners want to make people smile and experience great food and wonderful service. We go at least once a month

data.title: Good, not great
data.text: The food was pretty good, but some thing were "a little off".  The wine list included a Barolo by the glass, but when I tried to order it, the waiter said they hadn't offered it for "a long time".  The menu listed an app as Artichoke served the Jewish Roman way.  We asked the manager/host what that meant and he had no idea (and never tried to find out).
